div.head: John Green Will.
div.p:
In the name of God Amen I John Greene of Charless County in the
province of Maryland being very suck and weake of body but in sounds
and perfect memory I doe bequeath my body to the earth and my soule
to God almighty that gave it hoping by the merits of Jesus Christ
to be saved.
my will is that all my true and just Debts be satisfied

Item I will and bequeath unto John Allen three hundred acres of land.
and all my bills and Debts that belonges to me and all silver plate
and
or rings that doth belong to me.

Item. I give and bequeath unto William Deane two hundred acres of land with
one calf.

Item. I give and bequeath unto William Stenard one hundred acres of land with
one mare and one fole one cow and one calf.

Item. I give and appoint William Deane and William Stanard to be my
full and hole Executors and to see this my last will and testament hereby
performed as witness my hand and seal this twenty seventh day of
January Anno. Dom. 1675

On the back of the aforegoing will was endorsed the following probate (to wit)
Sept. 27th 1676 By virtue of a commission from the Judge in Testamentry
casues in the province of Maryland Dated the 15th day of June 1676
I called before me John Deane and Richard Ashew witnesses to the within
will who the day above within written proved the same by their oaths.
2 1/2 sides
Benjamin Rozer
